data.event: It was first settled in 1793 by Ezekiel Lewis, an English Loyalist supporter who was originally from Marlborough, New Hampshire.

event.title: named his location Lewis Falls and after 9 years

data.event: He named his location Lewis Falls and after 9 years, Captain Ezekiel Lewis sold his lot and moved only a short distance.

event.title: sold it to Hezekiah Robinson in 1822

data.event: The land was purchased by William Lamoure, a merchant from St-Armand who then sold it to Lazare Letourneau who in turn sold it to Hezekiah Robinson in 1822.
Waterloo became the summer residence of Montreal industrialist James Davidson in the 1880s.
